item.text: The ability scores are the six scores that are the core of your character. They affect everything else about your character.
Each ability will have a modifier, which is calculated using this formula
This is the number you add or subtract from a die roll when your character tries to do something related to that ability.

box.text: When a character assigns ability scores and determines their ability modifiers, they then assign the ability modifier for STR into FOC & POW and DEX into MRK & AGL, equal to the total ability modifier for that ability.
Example: A modifier of +2 could be divided into +2/+0, +1/+1, or +0/+2

item.text: Strength measures your character’s muscle and physical power. Strength also limits the amount of equipment your character can carry and determines the Recoil Modifier for the character. Strength is split into two groups

list.text: Focus (FOC) which encompasses a character’s hand-eye coordination with a melee weapon.
Power (POW) which is the actual strength of the character.

item.text: You apply your character’s STR modifier to

list.text: The skill that has STR as its key ability: Athletics
Strength checks (for breaking down doors and the like)

item.text: You apply your character’s FOC modifier to

list.text: Melee attack rolls

item.text: You apply your character’s POW modifier to

list.text: Damage rolls when using a melee weapon or a thrown weapon.

item.text: Dexterity measures hand-eye coordination, agility, reflexes, and balance. Dexterity is split into two groups

list.text: Marksmanship (MRK), which encompasses a character’s hand-eye coordination with a ranged weapon.
Agility (AGL), which encompasses the character’s overall movement.

item.text: You apply your Character’s Dexterity modifier to

list.text: The skills that have DEX as their key ability: Acrobatics, Drive, Pilot, and Ride

item.text: You apply your character’s MRK modifier to

list.text: Ranged attack rolls

item.text: You apply your character’s AGL modifier to

list.text: Defense Score
Reflex Saves
Initiative Score

item.text: Constitution represents your character’s health and stamina. A character’s CHP and XHP are determined by their Constitution score and modifier respectively. If either value changes, the CHPor XHP are increased or decreased accordingly. You apply your character’s Constitution modifier to

list.text: Determining CHP and XHP
Fortitude Saves

item.text: Intelligence determines how well your character learns and reasons. Intelligence is important for any character who wants to have a wide assortment of skills. You apply your character’s Intelligence modifier to

list.text: The number of skill points a character gets at first level and each level thereafter.
The skills that have INT as their key ability: Craft, Demolitions, Disable Device, Knowledge, and Technology Use.

item.text: Wisdom describes a character’s willpower, common sense, perception, and intuition. While INT represents one’s ability to analyze information, WIS represents being in tune with and aware of one’s surroundings. If you want your character to have acute senses, put a high score in WIS. You apply your character’s WIS modifier to

list.text: Will Saves
The skills that have WIS as their key ability: Perception and Treat Injury.

item.text: Charisma measures a character’s force of personality, persuasiveness, personal magnetism, ability to lead, and physical attractiveness. This ability represents actual strength of personality, not merely how one is perceived by others in asocial setting. You apply your character’s Charisma modifier to

list.text: The skills that have CHA as their key ability: Animal Handling, Perform, Presence, and Speechcraft.
